title: Alagnak Wild River: Basic Information
body: Explore This Park    Plan Your Visit     Basic Information             Basic Information           Physical Address           1000 Silver St., Bldg. 603 PO Box 7  King Salmon, AK 99613                 Directions         Alagnak Wild River is located in a remote part of the Alaska Peninsula, about 290 miles southwest of Anchorage. Access is by boat or small floatplane.  Directions Details           Operating Hours & Seasons         Alagnak Wild River Alagnak Wild River is never closed, but access can be difficult during the winter.   Standard Hours    Sunday: Open 24 hours   Monday: Open 24 hours   Tuesday: Open 24 hours   Wednesday: Open 24 hours   Thursday: Open 24 hours   Friday: Open 24 hours   Saturday: Open 24 hours             Weather           Located between the stormy north Pacific Ocean and the even stormier Bering Sea, the Alagnak Wild River is often a battleground between weather systems. When you visit, be prepared to encounter all types of weather.  On average, wet and cool conditions predominate in spring, summer, and fall. Winters are drier and colder.         Fees & Passes     Entrance Fees:   No Entrance Free - $0.00 None. there is no fee         Visitor Centers       King Salmon Interagency Visitor Center The King Salmon Visitor Center provides information on the many federal public lands of Southwest Alaska, particularly those in the Bristol Bay area. A large collection of films is available for viewing and an AGA bookstore sells maps, charts, videos, posters, clothing and more.                In-holdings of private property exist along the shores of Alagnak River. At no time is it permissible to enter private lands without prior consent from the landowner. Please respect the rights of property owners and avoid illegal trespassing.
